TopicTitle: How do I disable the automatic Kerbal rotation on EVA?

Articles.Content: Many youtubers and a few of the KSP streamers have spoken about or actually disabled the Kerbal rotation on EVA when you press W,A,S or D. I found a setting called "EVA_ROTATE_ON_MOVE = True", I changed it to "EVA_ROTATE_ON_MOVE = False" but every time I boot up the game, it changes back to default. Am I looking at the correct setting? Why does it switch back? How do I permanently change it so that it does not automatically rotate the Kerbals and waste EVA propellant?
In the Settings menu, under the Input/Other tab, there's a button labeled "EVAs auto-rotate to camera". Is that it?

In the Settings menu, under the Input/Other tab, there's a button labeled "EVAs auto-rotate to camera". Is that it?

This is probably the one you want. I don't know why editing your settings.cfg didn't work, unless you did it while KSP was running. It's the same option, but you can do it in game as per Starstrider.
